work.name: Equus Software
highlights: Designed and built a modern REST API following industry standard best practices which is used by 3rd party data providers and for client integrations with our main application.

Daily responsibilities include developing features and bug fixes for a major SaaS application, refining upcoming work and clarifying requirements, interfacing with other teams and departments to find solutions and answers, providing input on and acting as a SME for a variety of subjects, and maintaining and overseeing Azure DevOps pipelines, agents, tasks, and servers.

work.name: Agile Education Marketing
highlights: Created data management SaaS application used to support primary company database using ASP.NET MVC and Entity Framework.
Performed complete redesign and overhaul of legacy customer-facing email analytics and reporting web application.
Lead engineer and designer for the creation of an automated data collection software that is responsible for gathering, parsing, and synthesizing over 2 TB of data.
Created robust, flexible, and responsive web application which allows for the quick and intuitive compilation, search, and consumption of education data.
Oversaw development of a marketing automation system responsible for sending and processing results for 300k marketing emails daily using .NET Core 2 API and Angular 4.
Modernized legacy applications allowing for unit and acceptance level testing, as well as implemented CI/CD pipelines.
work.summary: As the lead full stack software engineer, I was responsible for all critical systems, services, and websites for the entire company. It was also my responsibility to plan and architect new systems, maintain the company servers, setup and oversee the companyâ€™s databases, and train and oversee junior developers.

projects.name: Next.js React Word Guesser Game
projects.description:
A Wordle-like React Next.js game with a few extra bells and whistles. This game adds features that the real Wordle doesn't currently have such as a hint system and the ability to configure how long you want the word you're guessing to be.
The site is hosted by Netlify, which is integrated with the project's GitHub repository for automatic CICD. Behind the scenes, the game utilizes a Google Firebase DB and external APIs for data loading, storage, and logging. The game was built on the Next.js framework in order to allow for server-side rendering which helps protect sensitive API keys from being exposed publicly when loading data from 3rd party APIs.

projects.name: Slack API Bot
projects.description:
A .NET 6 console application used to integrate with the Slack API and perform tasks like posting automatic announcements. This tool can integrate with Azure DevOps pipelines for builds, unit tests, and scheduled executions.
This concept was originally developed as a company-wide communication and productivity tool, and was built in order to announce newly created channels to the company each week so that as the team continued to grow, we had better visibility into what was happening across the company.

projects.name: Base64 File Converter
projects.description: A .NET Core 3.1 Windows Forms application for converting files to Base64 strings (both decompressed and deflated/compressed) and converting Base64 strings (both decompressed and deflated/compressed) to files.

projects.name: Personal Website
projects.description:
You're here right now! This site was built using React and Material UI and is hosted on Google Firebase. This site pulls data dynamically from a file that (mostly) follows the [JSON Resume spec](https://jsonresume.org/), with a few exceptions where I needed additional attributes beyond what the spec supported. That data is used to build much of the content on the site on the fly, including the links to my socials and even this project list.
The repository for this site utilizes GitHub Actions to automatically trigger CICD builds and deployments to Firebase on commits.
